description: Internal unique identifier for the GIS layer configuration record.
Human-readable name of the map layer shown in applications and reports.
Asset category the layer represents, used to link map features to fleet/asset records and drive business rules.
Name of the feature attribute that stores the asset/unit identifier used for joins and lookups.
Flag indicating whether attribute values should be quoted when building filters or queries against the feature service.
Minimum elevation at which features are considered or displayed for this layer; units likely meters—confirm with SME.
Maximum elevation at which features are considered or displayed for this layer; units likely meters—confirm with SME.
Display and processing order for the layer relative to other layers.
Indicates whether GIS is the authoritative system of record for this layer’s features, affecting edit direction and synchronization.
Permission flag controlling whether updates initiated in GIS can modify the corresponding asset records.
Permission flag controlling whether new features added in GIS can create corresponding asset records.
Permission flag controlling whether deletions in GIS can remove corresponding asset records.
Permission flag controlling whether renaming in GIS can change the identifier of the associated asset.
Endpoint URL of the feature service supplying this layer’s data for viewing and edits.
Number of features processed per batch during imports to manage performance and timeouts; exact semantics for 0 should be confirmed with SME.
Flag marking the layer as representing deficiencies/issues rather than assets, influencing workflows and symbology.
Indicates whether the layer configuration is active and visible to users.
User or service account that created this layer configuration record.
Timestamp when the layer configuration record was created.
User or service account that last updated this record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Application-specific rendering configuration (e.g., symbology rules) used to draw features.
Filter expression limiting which features from the source service are included in this layer.
List of feature attributes to suppress from user interfaces and exports.
Labeling configuration or field expression used to display text labels on the map.
Access control list of users or groups permitted to view or edit this layer.
Flag indicating whether this layer is excluded from offline use in mobile apps.
Name of the feature attribute containing email addresses for notifications or contacts; confirm with SME.
Settings governing offline caching and sync for mobile clients, such as refresh scope and attachments; confirm exact properties with SME.
Serialized style definition for the layer (e.g., ArcGIS symbolization) used by client applications to render features.
